# Test Reports Directory

This directory contains automatically generated test reports.

## Generated Reports

### Automatic Reports (Generated by pytest)

These reports are automatically generated when running `pytest`:

- **`junit.xml`** - JUnit XML format for CI/CD integration
- **`coverage.xml`** - Coverage data in XML format
- **`coverage_html/`** - HTML coverage report (open `index.html` in browser)

### Custom Reports

- **`comprehensive_integration_report.json`** - Generated by `comprehensive_integration_suite.py`
- **`simulation_test_report.json`** - Generated by simulation test framework
- **`simulation_test_report.html`** - HTML version of simulation report
- **`simulation_test_summary.md`** - Markdown summary for documentation

## Configuration

Reports are automatically generated via `tests/pytest.ini`:

```ini
--cov-report=html:tests/reports/coverage_html
--cov-report=xml:tests/reports/coverage.xml
--junitxml=tests/reports/junit.xml
```

## Viewing Reports

### Coverage Report
```bash
# Open in browser
open tests/reports/coverage_html/index.html
# Or
xdg-open tests/reports/coverage_html/index.html
```

### JUnit XML
```bash
# View with xmllint
xmllint --format tests/reports/junit.xml | less
```

### JSON Reports
```bash
# Pretty print
cat tests/reports/comprehensive_integration_report.json | python3 -m json.tool
```

## CI/CD Integration

The JUnit XML report (`junit.xml`) is compatible with:
- GitHub Actions
- Jenkins
- GitLab CI
- CircleCI
- Most CI/CD platforms

## Note

These reports are **tracked in git** (not in .gitignore) to enable:
- Historical test result tracking
- CI/CD artifact storage
- Team visibility into test status
